title: How's the Weather?
question_text:
Blue Fin Real Estate was interested in what prompted people to choose to live on either the East Coast or the West Coast. Random samples of $400$ people on each coast were asked what the most important factor was in their decision. On the East Coast, $68$ people chose weather and on the West Coast, $88$ people chose weather.
Blue Fin wanted to know if there was a difference in the proportions of choice of weather between people living on the East and West Coasts. Given a significance level of $\alpha=0.05$, determine the range of where the $p$-value falls and whether or not we can reject the null hypothesis that the proportions are really the same.

choices.text:
$0.025<p$-value$<0.05$
Fail to reject $Ho$, there is no difference in the proportions.

$0.05<p$-value$<0.10$
Fail to reject $Ho$, there is no difference in the proportions.

$0.05<p$-value$<0.10$
Reject $Ho$, there is a difference in the proportions.

$0.025<p$-value$<0.05$
Reject $Ho$, there is a difference in the proportions.

$0.05<p$-value$<0.10$
Reject $Ho$, there is no difference in the proportions.

Choice 'B' is the correct answer.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect because the

Choice 'C' is incorrect because it says to reject Ho and that should not be done.

Choice 'E' is incorrect because it says to reject Ho even though the following part of the sentence is correct.
